Node.definition: = the object that is to become someone's property through casting the lot
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= a wilderness area in the Negev (נֶגֶב) on the southern border of Canaan (כְּנַעַן) near Kadesh Barnea (קָדֵשׁ בַּרְנֵעַ)
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert
= area located to the south of a point of reference
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert

literally: the sea of salt; hence: = a large body of salt water located in the basin of the Jordan Valley, east of Judah; the Jordan River flows from the north into the northern part of this sea; the water is so salty that no living organism inhabits them
= literally: Sea of Salt; one of the names of the Dead Sea, because of the high concentration of salt in its water
= a broad inlet of the sea where the land curves inward
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert
literally: (a boundary or measuring line) goes out; hence: = state in which a boundary or measuring line follows a certain trajectory

= town, also known as En Mishpat (עֵין מִשְׁפָּט) , Kedesh (קֶדֶשׁ) and Kadesh (קָדֵשׁ) ◄ located in the Wilderness of Zin (צִן) in the northern part of Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula; ► Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) encamped there on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) to Canaan (כְּנַעַן) it is also the location of the Meribah (מְרִיבָה) spring; spies were sent out into Canaan from this place; it later marked the southern border of the territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= town; ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
literally: to go up; hence: = state in which one side of an area is at a higher elevation than the other

= village ◄ in the territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
literally: (a boundary or measuring line) goes out; hence: = state in which a boundary or measuring line follows a certain trajectory
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= town, formerly called Kiriath Sepher (קִרְיַת־סֵפֶר) also known as Kiriath Sannah (קִרְיַת סַנָּה) ◄ located in the hill country (הַר) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► assigned to clan of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= town, formerly called Kiriath Sepher (קִרְיַת־סֵפֶר) also known as Kiriath Sannah (קִרְיַת סַנָּה) ◄ located in the hill country (הַר) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► assigned to clan of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Jephunneh (יְפֻנֶּה) clan of Kenaz (קְנִזִּי) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town, also known as Kiriath Sannah (קִרְיַת סַנָּה) and later as Debir (דְּבִיר) ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► assigned to clan of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman; ◄ daughter of Caleb (כָּלֵב) ► wife of Othniel (עָתְנִיאֵל) judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= man; ◄ son of Kenaz (קְנַז) nephew of Caleb (כָּלֵב) ► first judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ brother of Caleb (כָּלֵב) ► father of the judge Othniel (עָתְנִיאֵל)
= close relative, such as one's uncle's son and one's brother's son, or someone else regarded as closely related
= man; ◄ son of Jephunneh (יְפֻנֶּה) clan of Kenaz (קְנִזִּי) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman; ◄ daughter of Caleb (כָּלֵב) ► wife of Othniel (עָתְנִיאֵל) judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= action by which humans get down from an animal they are riding

= domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see עַיִר (עַיִר) female see אָתֹון (אָתֹון)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Jephunneh (יְפֻנֶּה) clan of Kenaz (קְנִזִּי) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= objects, ◄ presented as gift by one person to another

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= an area of land located in the south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples initially by the Canaanites in Arad (עֲרָד) and the Amelekites (עֲמָלֵקִי) later, the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= a place where water wells up from an underground source

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a place where water wells up from an underground source

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a place where water wells up from an underground source
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person facing the direction of the rising sun, ◄ which is the direction of the Negev desert
= town, also known as Jekabzeel (יְקַּבְצְאֵל) ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= a town in southern Judah near the border with Edom ◄ belonging to the tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= town; ◄ on Judah (יְהוּדָה) southeastern border, near Edom (אֱדֹום)
= town; ◄ located on the southern border of the territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) possibly related to the Kenites (קֵינִי)
= a town, probably to be identified with Dibon (דִּיבֹון) ◄ located in the territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= town; ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

= town, also known as Kiriath Baal (קִרְיַת־בַּעַל) Baalah (בַּעֲלָה) and Baale Judah (בַּעֲלֵי יְהוּדָה) ◄ located in the hill country (הַר) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► one of the four Hivite (חִוִּי) cities that made a covenant with Joshua (יְהֹושׁוּעַ)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= inhabitant of Jebus (יְבוּס) ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= causative action by which humans or deities take over the ownership of land from other humans, which usually implies that the former owners are driven away
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= inhabitant of Jebus (יְבוּס) ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
